page.title: 11LOCAL CUSTOMS IN LLANBISTER
page.content: In this area a death is marked, most who knew the deceased having an obligation to attend the funeral,which is a major event. The service is usually held in a place of worship in the afternoon. This is followed by a simple tea provided by the family of the deceased. Catering is undertaken by friends or local women, in the church hall or village premises. Other customs involve business. The farmers enjoy haggling over prices this can be offputting to an outsider. When the deal is finally struck the cheque book is offered to the buyer who fills in the details, as a sort of trust between them. The owner then signs the completed cheque. This habit also takes place in shops and banks. Luck Money in the form of a coin is always given to a buyer of stock to ensure long life of the animals.
